assignments.value: ={{  $json["data"]   .map(v =>      `ðŸŽ¥ *${v["Video Title"]}*   ðŸ‘¤ ${v["Educator"]}   ðŸ§© Difficulty: ${v["Difficulty"]}   ðŸ”— ${v["YouTube Link"]}   ðŸ“ ${v["Description"]}`   )   .join("\n\n") }}

parameters.content:
## ðŸŽ“ n8n Learning Hub - YouTube Educator Search

Search a curated database of n8n tutorial videos by topic using Data Tables and webhooks.

## How it works

**Search API** (top branch): Webhook receives search queries â†’ normalizes keywords â†’ queries Data Table â†’ formats results â†’ returns matching videos

**Database Setup** (bottom branch): Manual trigger â†’ loads 10 video records â†’ loops through each â†’ inserts into Data Table

## Setup steps

1. Create a Data Table named "n8n_Educator_Videos" with columns: Educator, video_title, Difficulty, YouTubeLink, Description
2. Run the bottom branch first by clicking "Execute workflow" on the manual trigger node
3. Verify 10 videos inserted into your Data Table
4. Activate the workflow and copy the webhook Production URL
5. Test with POST request: `{"topic": "voice"}` or `{"topic": "scraping"}`

Connect your own frontend or use tools like Postman to query the API.

## Search API

Receives POST requests with search topic, normalizes keywords, queries the Data Table, and returns formatted results.

## Format Response

Transforms query results into user-friendly format with emojis and returns via webhook.

## Database Initialization

One-time setup to populate the Data Table with video records. Run this before using the search API.
